quotes.quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth.
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Giving is the highest expression of potency...Giving is more joyous than receiving, not because it is a deprivation, but because in the act of giving lies the expression of my aliveness.
To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
Give yourself entirely to those around you. Be generous with your blessings. A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give.
Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.
Love only grows by sharing. You can only have more for yourself by giving it away to others.
The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving.
It is every man's obligation to put back into the world at least the equivalent of what he takes out of it.
The value of a man resides in what he gives and not in what he is capable of receiving.
I don't think you ever stop giving. I really don't. I think it's an on-going process. And it's not just about being able to write a check. It's being able to touch somebody's life.
Give cheerfully and freely. It is the energy behind the giving that matters so do not give grudgingly. The law of cause and effect guarantees that you shall receive plenty for what you give.
If you have much, give of your wealth; If you have little, give of your heart.
Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
Giving back is something that comes from the heart to me. It's not that I do it because it's the right thing: I do it because I want do it.
When you're in a position to have gotten so much, the gift at this point is giving back.

Hope and purpose in this world is living as best as you can and maybe having life that gives back. But simply giving back isn't purpose; it's a branch of purpose, but it is not the trunk or root of the tree.
It's enough to indulge and to be selfish but true happiness is really when you start giving back.
That's what I consider true generosity. You give your all, and yet you always feel as if it costs you nothing.
When you learn, teach. When you get, give.
It is more blessed to give than to receive.
Social advance depends quite as much upon an increase in moral sensibility as it does upon a sense of duty.
I have found that among its other benefits, giving liberates the soul of the giver.
Every charitable act is a stepping stone towards heaven.
Life engenders life. Energy creates energy. It is by spending oneself that one becomes rich.
I don't know what your destiny will be, but one thing I do know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who have sought and found how to serve.
Everyone can be great, because everyone can serve.
We are not put on this earth for ourselves, but are placed here for each other. If you are there always for others, then in time of need, someone will be there for you.
Caring has the gift of making the ordinary special.
Love cannot remain by itself   it has no meaning. Love has to be put into action and that action is service.
If you haven't got any charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.

Giving with glad and generous hearts has a way of routing out the tough old miser within us. Even the poor need to know that they can give. Just the very act of letting go of money, or some other treasure, does something within us. It destroys the demon greed.
One man gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds unduly, but comes to poverty.
Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.
What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
You have not lived today until you have done something for someone who can never repay you.

When you become detached mentally from yourself and concentrate on helping other people with their difficulties, you will be able to cope with your own more effectively. Somehow, the act of self-giving is a personal power-releasing factor.
Unless we think of others and do something for them, we miss one of the greatest sources of happiness.
It is normal to give away a little of one's life in order not to lose it all.
When you give yourself, you receive more than you give.
There is no delight in owning anything unshared.
It is like the seed put in the soil -- the more one sows, the greater the harvest.
Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
If you have zest and enthusiasm you attract zest and enthusiasm. Life does give back in kind.
Love life. Engage in it. Give it all you've got. Love it with a passion because life truly does give back, many times over, what you put into it.
I believe that as much as you take, you have to give back. It's important not to focus on yourself too much.
Not he who has much is rich, but he who gives much.
From what we get, we can make a living. What we give, however, makes a life.
The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
He who cannot give anything away cannot feel anything either.
Your mind will give back to you exactly what you put into it.
